words.definition: To certify something means to state that it is true or correct officially.
words.example: The doctor certified that the man was healthy enough to work.

words.definition: To collaborate means to work together on a project.
words.example: The two scientists collaborated on the research paper.

words.definition: To compile means to collect information from different places and put it together.
words.example: He compiled a list of all the books he wanted to read.

words.definition: To counteract something means to act against it so as to reduce its effect.
words.example: The medicine helped to counteract the effects of the poison.

words.definition: To curb something means to control or limit it.
words.example: The government is trying to curb inflation.

words.definition: To diagnose means to identify a medical condition or disease.
words.example: The doctor diagnosed him with a rare blood disorder.

words.definition: To enact means to make a proposal into a law.
words.example: The new law was enacted earlier this year.

words.definition: A federation is a group of states or organizations that have joined together.
words.example: The international sports federation oversees the competition.

words.definition: If something is gross, it is disgusting.
words.example: The food was so gross that I couldn’t eat it.

words.definition: If someone is humane, they show compassion and kindness.
words.example: The treatment of the prisoners was not very humane.

words.definition: If something is intolerable, it is so bad that people cannot bear it.
words.example: The weather was so intolerable that I had to put on my warmest clothes.

words.definition: If someone is needy, they are very poor.
words.example: After he lost his job, he became very needy.

words.definition: The onset of something unpleasant is the beginning of it.
words.example: At the onset of the battle, the enemy wasn’t prepared for such a large attack.

words.definition: To pledge means to make a promise to do something.
words.example: Her mother pledged that she would find her daughter’s lost kitten.

words.definition: To prohibit something means to not allow it.
words.example: She prohibited the students from speaking until their work was done.

words.definition: A rash is an infected area of the skin with redness or bumps.
words.example: The new perfume left a horrible rash on my skin.

words.definition: To render something means to make it become something else.
words.example: His report was rendered unimportant by the release of new information.

words.definition: Smallpox is a serious and contagious disease.
words.example: Many people died of smallpox before a vaccine was found.

words.definition: To transmit something means to pass it from one person or place to another.
words.example: The disease is transmitted through the air.

words.definition: To vow means to make a serious promise to do something.
words.example: He vowed that he would never lie again.
